The representativeness heuristic is the tendency to judge the probability of an event by how well it matches our preconceived notions or stereotypes, rather than using statistical reasoning.

The conjunction fallacy is the tendency to judge a specific combination of characteristics as more probable than a single, more general characteristic.

In this case, option (b) "Morgan is a therapist and frequently volunteers at local clean-up drives to enhance urban green spaces" seems to align more closely with our stereotypical view of an environmentally-conscious and socially engaged person like Morgan.
